sect2.title: What is &app;
sect2.para: &app; is an instant messaging program for the GNOME Desktop. It allows instant communication across a network using the Jabber protocol. &app; is written to be as simple to use as possible and to allow users of the GNOME Desktop to easily keep in touch with friends.

sect2.title: What is Jabber
sect2.para: Jabber is an open instant messaging protocol standard which allows a group of interconnected servers to pass messages to one another in a similar fashion to email.

Some features of the Jabber protocol include:
Open, Free, and Public
Internet Engineering Task Force (IETF) Standard
Proven and working since 1998
Decentralized and Secure
Extensible with Custom Functionality
Flexible and can be used in Diverse situations
More information on the Jabber protocol can be found on the Website of the Jabber Software Foundation.

sect2.title: To Start &app;
sect2.para: You can start &app; in the following ways:

listitem.para:
Choose
Internet Gossip Instant Messenger .
To start &app; from a command line, type gossip and then press Return.

sect2.title: When You Start &app; the First Time
sect2.para: When you start &app; the first time, the following window is displayed.

textobject.phrase: Shows &app;s first start window which is an assistant to set up &app;.

sect2.para: This window is an assistant to set up &app;. With this assistant you can set up &app; in few steps. You can use it to get a new Jabber account or setting up &app; for using an existing Jabber account.

sect2.title: Getting a Jabber Account
sect2.para: &app; will help set up a new Jabber account:

listitem.para: When first running &app;, answer No to the "Do you already have an account on a Jabber server?" question and click Next.
Fill in desired user name and actual name and click Next.
Add the server information.
Choose the correct server for the account from the list, or type in a custom server if needed.
Select the Use encryption (SSL) option if your server supports it or requires it.
Select the Use system proxy option if you use a proxy.
Once all options are set, click Next.
Review the information and click Apply.
When prompted on first connection with the account, enter desired password.

sect2.title: Setting Up &app; to use an Existing Jabber Account
sect2.para: &app; will let you use an existing Jabber account:

listitem.para: When first running &app;, answer Yes to the "Do you already have an account set up on a server?" question and click Next.
Fill in the user name of the account and click Next.
Add the server information.
Choose the correct server for the account from the list, or type in a custom server if needed.
Select the Use encryption (SSL) option if your server requires it.
Select the Use system proxy option if you use a proxy.
Once all options are set, click Next.
Review the information and click Apply.
When prompted on first connection with the account, enter desired password.

sect2.title: When You Start &app;
sect2.para: When you start &app;, the following window is displayed.

textobject.phrase: Shows &app; main window. Contains titlebar, menubar, contact list, status icon and status drop-down list. Menubar contains Chat, Edit and Help menus.

sect2.para: The &app; window contains the following elements:

listitem.para: The menus on the menubar contain all of the commands you needed to connect to servers and manage accounts, contacts, and preferences in &app;.
The buttons on the account toolbar allow you, depending on account state, to connect, disconnect, and edit an account.

note.para: The accounts toolbar is only visible if you have more than two Jabbers accounts set-up in &app;.

listitem.para: The Contact List shows all available contacts and their associated statuses.
This shows the current status of the user.
You can use this selector to change your online state.

sect1.title: Usage
sect1.para: You can use the &app; application to perform the following tasks:

sect2.title: Connect to a Jabber Server
sect2.para:
To connect to a Jabber server, choose
Chat Connect
from the Menubar.

sect2.title: Disconnect from a Jabber Server
sect2.para:
To disconnect from a Jabber server, choose
Chat Disconnect
from the Menubar.

sect2.title: Sending An Instant Message
sect2.para: You can send instant messages to a contact, in the following ways:

listitem.para: Double click on the contact's nickname in the Contact List, to open the chat window.

Choose
Ctrl N
Chat New Message
. A question dialog while be displayed, asking for the user ID of the person you wish to send an instant message to. Select the contact that you wish to send an instant message to from the drop-down box, and click Chat.

Right click on &app;'s Notification Area icon, and select New Message. A question dialog while be displayed, asking for the user ID of the person you wish to send an instant message to. Select the contact that you wish to send an instant message to from the drop-down box, and click Chat.

sect2.title: Adding a Contact
sect2.para: If you add a contact to your contact list, you can see when this person is online. To add a contact, perform the following steps:

listitem.para:
Choose
Chat Add Contact
from the Menubar, to open the Add Contact dialog.
Use the Which account do you want to add this contact to? drop-down box to specify which account to add a contact to.
Enter the Jabber ID of new contact, and then click Forward.

tip.para: The Jabber ID (JID) looks like an email-address. Example: name@host.domain

listitem.para: Enter What nickname do you want to use for this contact?, this is the nickname that will be displayed in the Contact List.

Use the In which group do you want to place this contact? drop-down box to choose a group for this contact. The contact will be displayed in the Contact List under the chosen group name. Click Forward when finished.
Review the information displayed and click Apply..

note.para: A request will sent to the contact, asking to subscribe to their presence notifications. Until this request is approved, the user will be shown as "Offline" in your Contact List. In addition, everybody who wants to add you to their Contact List, needs your authorization.

sect2.title: Show Offline Contact's
sect2.para:
To show offline contact's in the Contact list, choose
Ctrl O
Chat Show Offline Contacts

sect2.title: Accessing a Contact's Information
sect2.para: To access a contact's information, right click a contact's nickname in the Contact List and select Contact Information.

sect2.title: Renaming a Contact
sect2.para: To rename a contact in the Contact List, perform the following steps:

listitem.para: Right click a contact's nickname in the Contact List and select Rename Contact.
Enter a new name and click OK to apply, or Cancel to discard all changes.

sect2.title: Removing a Contact
sect2.para: To remove a contact, right click a contact's nickname in the Contact List and select Remove Contact. Click Yes when prompted to finish removal.

sect2.title: Edit Account Personal Information

listitem.para: Select the Account you wish to edit from the drop-down box.
To edit your name, edit the contents of the Name text box.
To edit your nickname, edit the contents of the Nickname text box.
To edit your e-mail address, edit the contents of the Email text box.
To edit your web address, edit the contents of the Web site text box.
To edit your description, edit the contents of the Description text box.
After reviewing the information, click Apply.

sect1.title: Settings
sect1.para:
To configure &app;, choose
Edit Preferences . The Preferences dialog contains the following tabbed sections:

listitem.para: Select the Convert smileys to graphical images option, to enable graphical images.
Select the Open new chats in separate windows option, to open chats in separate windows.
Select the Play sound when messages arrive option to enable sounds.
Select the Disable sounds when busy option to disable sounds when busy.
Select the Disable sounds when away option to disable sounds when away.

note.para: These setting might not be available if spell checking capabilities were not compiled into &app;.

listitem.para: Select the languages you wish to enable for spell checking

tip.para: The list of languages only reflect the languages that have a dictionary installed.

listitem.para: Select the Check spelling while I type option, to enable spell checking.
